org.apache.derbyTesting.unitTests.junit

Class ReaderToUTF8StreamTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseTestCase
          • org.apache.derbyTesting.unitTests.junit.ReaderToUTF8StreamTest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    junit.framework.Test

    public class ReaderToUTF8StreamTest
extends BaseTestCase
    Unit tests for ReaderToUTF8Stream.

    Explicit tests for the mark/reset feature start with "testMark".

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  ReaderToUTF8StreamTest.StreamUtil
      Utility class executing a few selected method calls on two streams, expecting both of them to behave in the same way.

      static junit.framework.Test suite() 
      void testHeaderPresentInStream_Internal()
      Makes sure that the header bytes are copied when creating a new buffer to hold all the required bytes when the stream has been marked.
      void testMarkReadAlmostUntilEOF()
      Marks the stream with a read ahead limit larger than the stream itself, then reads until just before the end of the stream.

      Marks the stream with a read ahead limit larger than the stream itself, then reads until the end of the stream.

      Tests mark/reset functionality by comparing with ByteArrayInputStream.

      Tests mark/reset functionality by comparing with ByteArrayInputStream.
      void testMarkResetExceedReadAheadLimitFail_Internal()
      Tests that the reset-call will fail we exceed the mark ahead limit and the internal buffer has to be refilled.
      void testMarkResetExceedReadAheadLimitOK_Internal()
      Tests an implementation specific feature of ReaderToUTF8Stream, which is that the mark isn't invalidated even though we read past the read ahead limit, given that the internal buffer doesn't have to be refilled.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_INTERNAL_BUFFER_SIZE

        private static int DEFAULT_INTERNAL_BUFFER_SIZE
        The default size of the internal buffer in ReaderToUTF8Stream. Used to trigger specific events in the reader.

      • testMarkResetShiftBytesMany_Internal

        public void testMarkResetShiftBytesMany_Internal()
                                          throws java.io.IOException
        Tests that shifting of existing bytes works.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if something goes wrong

      • testMarkResetExceedReadAheadLimitOK_Internal

        public void testMarkResetExceedReadAheadLimitOK_Internal()
                                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Tests an implementation specific feature of ReaderToUTF8Stream, which is that the mark isn't invalidated even though we read past the read ahead limit, given that the internal buffer doesn't have to be refilled.

        WARNING:This implementation specific feature should not be relied on by the production code! It may change at any time.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if something goes wrong

      • testMarkResetExceedReadAheadLimitFail_Internal

        public void testMarkResetExceedReadAheadLimitFail_Internal()
                                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Tests that the reset-call will fail we exceed the mark ahead limit and the internal buffer has to be refilled.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if something goes wrong

      • testMarkResetOverflowInternalBufferKeepBytes

        public void testMarkResetOverflowInternalBufferKeepBytes()
                                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Reads almost enough bytes to read past the read ahead limit, then tests that the reset works. After that, reads past the read ahead limit and tests that the reset fails.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if something goes wrong

      • testMarkReadUntilEOF

        public void testMarkReadUntilEOF()
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Marks the stream with a read ahead limit larger than the stream itself, then reads until the end of the stream.

        The current implementation does not allow the stream to be reset after the last byte in the stream has been read once.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if something goes wrong

      • testMarkReadAlmostUntilEOF

        public void testMarkReadAlmostUntilEOF()
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Marks the stream with a read ahead limit larger than the stream itself, then reads until just before the end of the stream.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if something goes wrong

      • testHeaderPresentInStream_Internal

        public void testHeaderPresentInStream_Internal()
                                        throws java.io.IOException
        Makes sure that the header bytes are copied when creating a new buffer to hold all the required bytes when the stream has been marked. This will only happen the first time the buffer is filled, i.e. when the stream is marked before the first read (mark at position zero).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if something goes wrong

      • getStream

        private java.io.InputStream getStream(int length)
        Returns a stream to test, loaded with the repeating modern latin lowercase alphabet.
        Parameters:
        length - the length of the stream in characters
        Returns:
        A stream serving bytes.

      • checkBeginningOfStream

        private void checkBeginningOfStream(java.io.InputStream is)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Checks the beginning of the stream, which is expected to consist of five header bytes (skipped) followed by the bytes for the characters 'a' and 'b'.
        Parameters:
        is - the stream to check
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if reading from the stream fails
        AssertionFailedError - if the stream content isn't as expected

      • fillArray

        private void fillArray(java.io.InputStream is,
                       byte[] b)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Fills the array by reading from the stream.
        Parameters:
        is - input stream to read from
        b - array to fill with bytes from the stream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if reading from the array fails, or the end of the stream is reached

      • testRandomSequence

        public void testRandomSequence()
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Performs a series of random operations on a ReaderToUTF8Stream, consisting of read, skip, mark, reset and a noop.

        Note: Turn on debugging (derby.tests.debug=true) to see some information, turn on tracing (derby.tests.trace=true) in addition to see a lot more information.

        If the test fails, the seed will be reported in the error message, and the load that failed can be rerun.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the test fails

      • testRandomSequence

        private void testRandomSequence(long seed)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Performs a series of random operations on a ReaderToUTF8Stream, consisting of read, skip, mark, reset and a noop.

        Note that this test verifies that executing the operations don't fail, but it doesn't verify that the bytes obtained from the stream are the correct ones.

        Parameters:
        seed - seed controlling the test load
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the test fails

      • getRandomLength

        private int getRandomLength(int currentPos,
                            int length,
                            java.util.Random rng)
        Returns a random length within the limits.

        This call will operate in the full range of the remaining bytes.

        Parameters:
        currentPos - the current position of the stream
        length - the length of the stream
        rng - random generator
        Returns:
        A random length within the limits of the stream.

      • getRandomLength

        private int getRandomLength(int currentPos,
                            int length,
                            java.util.Random rng,
                            boolean reducedSize)
        Returns a random length within the limits.
        Parameters:
        currentPos - the current position of the stream
        length - the length of the stream
        rng - random generator
        reducedSize - whether to return smaller number or not (setting to true may increase the number of operations that will be performed on a stream before it is exhausted)
        Returns:
        A random length within the limits of the stream.

      • mytrace

        private void mytrace(java.lang.String str)
        Trace only if both trace and verbose is true in the test configuration.
        Parameters:
        str - the string to print

      • testMarkReset1

        public void testMarkReset1()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Tests mark/reset functionality by comparing with ByteArrayInputStream.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the test fails

      • testMarkReset2_Internal

        public void testMarkReset2_Internal()
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Tests mark/reset functionality by comparing with ByteArrayInputStream. This test relies on knowing the size of the internal buffer to force a shifting of existing bytes to take place.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the test fails
